channel.title: Help making a client not connect to update server
channel.description: i was trying to make client 445 skip the whole "connect to update server bit" but every time i seem to do that and try to load up the game the client crashes and spits out the gamecrash error. so if anyone has done this before and would like to share some tips im open for suggestion :p

item.title: Help making a client not connect to update server
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

i ended up turning this:

PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560 = new Class48((Socket) (Node_Sub_Sub16.aDataHandle_2841.result),Class42.aClass11_978);
ByteStream byteStream = new ByteStream(5);
byteStream.writeByte(15); // sends to connect to update server
byteStream.writeInt(445); // sends client version

to this:

PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560 = new Class48(new Socket("p06.runescape.com",43594),Class42.aClass11_978);
ByteStream byteStream = new ByteStream(5);
byteStream.writeByte(15); // sends to connect to update server
byteStream.writeInt(455); // sends client version

probly not the best way to do it but it does bypass the client out of date error, and the connection error. ofcourse now weekly ill have to change the client version.

Read full topic
item.source: Help making a client not connect to update server

item.title: Help making a client not connect to update server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It has been well over a year since I fixed the 317 client to not connect to the update servers, so I don’t remember exactly what needs to be done. The best advice I can give you is to look at the 317 deob that I commented out to skip the update server, find the similar blocks in the latest client and do the same with them.

Read full topic
item.source: Help making a client not connect to update server

item.title: Help making a client not connect to update server
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:8, topic:71909”]There’s not much to go on for fixing that issue. You need to go into a bit more detail of what you tried. There are many, many reasons why the game would crash. They range from sending a bad packet to crc check failures and everything in between.

Out of curiosity, why would you not want to bypass their ‘connecting to update server…’ portion? The crc’s are embedded in the cache files themselves, not connecting to the update server doesn’t get you much, you’ll still crash due to the crc checks the game does during login.

Be more specific about what you have tried.[/quote]
oh the paste expired 1 sec ill just pull up the code

    private final void method38(int i) {
        anInt1793++;
        if (Node_Sub12.numInvalidCRCs >= 4) {
            this.method29("js5crc", (byte) -70);
            Class17.anInt491 = 1000;
        } else {
            if (Node_Sub3.anInt1851 >= 4) {
                if (Class17.anInt491 > 5) {
                    Class38.anInt875 = 3000;
                    Node_Sub3.anInt1851 = 3;
                } else {
                    this.method29("js5io", (byte) -82);
                    Class17.anInt491 = 1000;
                    return;
                }
            }
            /* if (Class38.anInt875-- <= 0) { // comment from here
                do {
                    try {
                        if (Class54.anInt1222 == 0) {
                            Node_Sub_Sub16.aDataHandle_2841
                                    = Class42.aClass11_978
                                    .method651(Class70.anInt1641, 0);
                            Class54.anInt1222++;
                        }
                        if (Class54.anInt1222 == 1) {
                            if (Node_Sub_Sub16.aDataHandle_2841.status
                                    == 2) {
                                method41(true, -1);
                                break;
                            }
                            if (Node_Sub_Sub16.aDataHandle_2841.status == 1)
                                Class54.anInt1222++;
                        }
                        if (Class54.anInt1222 == 2) {
                            PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560
                                    = new Class48((Socket) (Node_Sub_Sub16
                                    .aDataHandle_2841
                                    .result),
                                    Class42.aClass11_978);
                            ByteStream byteStream = new ByteStream(5);
                            byteStream.writeByte(15); // sends to connect to update server
                            byteStream.writeInt(445); // sends client version
                            PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560.method888(5, 32741, 0, byteStream.buffer); //waits for return code
                            Class54.anInt1222++;
                            Node_Sub_Sub11.aLong2666 = Class41.method838(0);
                        }
                        if (Class54.anInt1222 == 3) {
                            if (Class17.anInt491 <= 5 || PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560.availableBytes() > 0) {
                                int i_8_ = PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560.read(); // reads retune code
                                if (i_8_ != 0) { 
                                    method41(true, i_8_); // error report  js5connect_full,js5connect_outofdate,js5connect
                                    break;
                                }
                                Class54.anInt1222++;
                            } else if ((-Node_Sub_Sub11.aLong2666
                                    + Class41.method838(0))
                                    > 30000L) {
                                method41(true, -2); // error report i think this one sends the gamecrashed print stack error
                                break;
                            }
                        }
                        if (Class54.anInt1222 == 4) {
                            Player.method136
                                    (PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560, (byte) -127,
                                            Class17.anInt491 > 20);
                            PlayerDefinition.aClass48_1560 = null;
                            Node_Sub_Sub16.aDataHandle_2841 = null;
                            Class6.anInt220 = 0;
                            Class54.anInt1222 = 0;
                        }
                        if (i > 39)
                            break;
                        init();
                    } catch (java.io.IOException ioexception) {
                        method41(true, -3);
                        break;
                    }
                    break;
                } while (false);
            } */ to here
                            Class6.anInt220 = 0; // added this
                            Class54.anInt1222 = 0; // added this
			    init(); //added this
        }
    }

item.source: Help making a client not connect to update server

item.title: Help making a client not connect to update server
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

There’s not much to go on for fixing that issue. You need to go into a bit more detail of what you tried. There are many, many reasons why the game would crash. They range from sending a bad packet to crc check failures and everything in between.

Out of curiosity, why would you not want to bypass their ‘connecting to update server…’ portion? The crc’s are embedded in the cache files themselves, not connecting to the update server doesn’t get you much, you’ll still crash due to the crc checks the game does during login.

Be more specific about what you have tried.

Read full topic
